title: Employee scheduling rule making records (NY Gov)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Employee scheduling rule making records (NY Gov)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to the "employee scheduling" or "call-in pay" rule (LAB-47-17-00011) developed under Labor Commissioner Roberta Reardon at the direction of Governor Andrew Cuomo. Responsive documents include, but are not limited to, press releases, public statements, memoranda, reports, testimony, letters, emails and attachments prepared, issued, or received by the Governor or his agents during the period 7/1/2016–12/31/2018.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer to receive the responsive records in an electronic format through the online portal or by email attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Peter Fugiel, 
 
Thank you for registering with New York State Executive Chamber FOIL Records Access Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 Your Login ID is:  154561-95078381@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HRWPRG2sxdIKUIwWceCMgRCz6WwCneBB3vJ-2F0tnmLoyuj5rlO5jcIoPNvhpfrTYPVLD8Xm6ehHqyE9qrS5koWe0-3D95uO_iL6ZcVy52Y7NGuF0uOqQJrVUQk7VUL-2F-2FhelwCMoUiinfw31PL1eK0G0mo5iGBWrlprSphJyeQaZ288bYntAUUd9RxEY6AUvnxwhlr8QsvLuLvsJTrROLKMz9p-2BRvzl8ErP5BTCVryb8XQmR-2FQn-2F4MpPG-2BWsfSoKGK7qHTjPUbxZ6ntu-2FWslfEYz5iXEJOcXG30BttiW4McKXYk-2BZZW-2BovWc8IxEOBsxRyiad8hiinto-3D)

communications.subject: FOIL Records Request :: R000858-111523
communications.communication:
Dear Peter Fugiel: 
This message acknowledges receipt of your request. Your request was received in this office on 11/15/2023 and given the reference number R000858-111523 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to the "employee scheduling" or "call-in pay" rule (LAB-47-17-00011) developed under Labor Commissioner Roberta Reardon at the direction of Governor Andrew Cuomo. Responsive documents include, but are not limited to, press releases, public statements, memoranda, reports, testimony, letters, emails and attachments prepared, issued, or received by the Governor or his agents during the period 7/1/2016–12/31/2018.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer to receive the responsive records in an electronic format through the online portal or by email attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fgovernors-office-194%252Femployee-scheduling-rule-making-records-ny-gov-154561%252F%253Femail%253Drecords.access%252540exec.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAjx3ExrOuYhrIgEJLPr3f_MM8%3A1r3RXY%3AVFsMcMcpwM-upvcJg1Q41uv5n-lLKFUVIhaSnnMotRg
